snippet: At an age when most goalies are flipping through their scrapbooks, the Devils’ Martin Brodeur, 40, is playing with the enthusiasm of a rookie.
abstract: Charles McGrath On Hockey column holds that it never gets old watching New Jersey Devils goaltender Martin Brodeur, who is preparing for Game 2 of Stanley Cup finals against Los Angeles Kings; asserts at an age when most goalies are flipping through their scrapbooks, 40-year-old Brodeur is still the best puck-handling goaltender in the NHL and is playing with the enthusiasm of a rookie.
lead_paragraph: At an age when most goalies are flipping through their scrapbooks, the Devils’ Martin Brodeur, 40, is playing with the enthusiasm of a rookie.

headline.seo: Watching Devils Goalie Martin Brodeur Never Gets Old
headline.main: Watching Devils’ Brodeur Never Gets Old
